description: The issue involves the Windows NT operating system failing to properly initialize the user session during login due to an incorrect registry value for 'userinit'. This registry value can be found at 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon'. If the value is not correctly set to 'C:\Windows\System32\userinit.exe', the system may experience login problems, such as a black screen or an inability to load user profiles. It is essential for system administrators to verify this registry setting to rule out potential issues. Modifications to this key impact the user's ability to log into their account and start the session correctly.
